case_vignette: A 77-year-old man comes to your office for a routine visit. He is doing well, and his only complaint is the recent appearance of several brown greasy appearing lesions on his forehead (figure A) that he can't seem to peel off.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got some brown greasy spots on my forehead that just won't scrape off.
Have you noticed any redness or itching around the spots?
No, there's no redness or itching.
Have you had any similar spots in the past?
No, this is the first time I've had these spots.
Have you recently traveled to a tropical or subtropical region?
No, I haven't traveled to any tropical or subtropical regions.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
No, there haven't been any changes in my diet or lifestyle.
Have you had any recent stressful events or changes in your sleep patterns?
There's nothing mentioned about stress or changes in my sleep, so no, I haven't had any stressful events or changes in sleep patterns.
Have you had any recent skin infections or injuries?
No, I haven't had any skin infections or injuries recently.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or overall health?
My overall health is good, and there haven't been any changes in my weight.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
No, I haven't had any changes in my medication or supplements.
Have you had any family members with similar symptoms?
There's no mention of family members with similar symptoms, so no, I haven't had family members with similar symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Seborrheic Dermatitis.
